intro: Centaurea ratezatensis, commonly known as the Retezat centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Retezat Mountains in Romania. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its bright blue or purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species, highlighting its ecological significance in its native habitat.
